page.title: 05HORSE RIDING AT YORK.
page.content: Monday and Friday are riding nights at York. Monday is club night. At the club the Major lets us use his horse and the stadium. The first thing is to brush the horses down. This is to get all the mud and dust off after they have been rolling in the fields. Next we put on their saddles and bridles. Then we take them into the stadium. As soon as they are in, we have to tighten the girths and lengthen the stirrups. Then it's hop on the horse and trot off. Sometimes we jump, sometimes we do road safety, that is boring. The best thing on a Monday is all of us cantering round, even 30year old Snowy. After one hour it's dismount and lead out to the courtyard, then unsaddle them. We take them to the fields. Friday night is the same but Major Cole teaches us. Nicola Williams
